pullRequest.body:
CardinalInterFilter generalizes CountableInterFilter to allow for a specific cardinality, where the filter must be stable under intersections over a number of sets lower than this cardinality.

Prepares the way for K-Lindel√∂f spaces.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Thanks again for doing this.

Please also add a comment to the `CountableInterFilter` file saying something like:
```
Note that there also exists a typeclass `CardinalInterFilter`, and thus an alternative spelling of
`CountableInterFilter` as `CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1)`. The former (defined here) is the
preferred spelling; it has the advantage of not requiring the user to import the theory ordinals.
```
(or similar)

bors d+

Thank you for doing this; many apologies for being so slow to review.

I was going to suggest that we do not need to have both `CardinalInterFilter` and `CountableInterFilter` and that instead of adding this new definition could we just replace `CountableInterFilter` with `CardinalInterFilter` and:
```
abbrev CountableInterFilter (l : Filter Œ±) := CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1)
```
as well as API for `CountableInterFilter` to connect with `Set.Countable`.

However it is not clear to me that every user of `CountableInterFilter` should need to import the full theory of ordinals, so this seems like a reasonable case for having two definitions (at least for now).

The code looks great, I have some nitpicks below and I'll take another pass quickly after you have replied.

Thanks again for doing this.

Please also add a comment to the `CountableInterFilter` file saying something like:
```
Note that there also exists a typeclass `CardinalInterFilter`, and thus an alternative spelling of
`CountableInterFilter` as `CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1)`. The former (defined here) is the
preferred spelling; it has the advantage of not requiring the user to import the theory ordinals.
```
(or similar)

bors d+

```suggestion
property: for any collection of sets `s ‚àà l` with cardinality strictly less than `c`, their intersection
```
This should refer to `cardinal intersection property` rather than `countable intersection property`, right?

Can this be an instance:
```suggestion
instance CountableInterFilter.toCardinalInterFilter (l : Filter Œ±) [CountableInterFilter l] :
```

```suggestion
theorem CardinalInterFilter.of_CardinalInterFilter_of_lt (l : Filter Œ±) [CardinalInterFilter l c]
```

```suggestion
theorem _root_.Filter.cardinalInterFilter_aleph0 (l : Filter Œ±) : CardinalInterFilter l aleph0 where
```

This looks like a good place to enter a namespace. We could use `CardinalInterFilter` but I think we could just use `Filter`:
```suggestion
namespace Filter

```
I note that you are following `CountableInterFilter` which does not namespace the corresponding results but I claim it should (you can add a namespace to `CountableInterFilter` as part of these changes if you like).

I propose we postpone changing `CountableInterFilter` that until we know if we will refactor `CountableInterFilter` in terms of `CardinalInterFilter`, which is something I want to PR after this PR merges.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:

```suggestion
* `Filter.cardinalInterFilter_aleph0` establishes that every filter `l` is a
```

```suggestion
* `CardinalInterFilter.of_CardinalInterFilter_of_lt` establishes that we have
    `CardinalInterFilter l c` ‚Üí `CardinalInterFilter l a` for all `a < c`.
```

```suggestion
    (EventuallyLE.cardinal_bInter hS fun i hi => (h i hi).symm.le)
    
end Filter
```

```suggestion

theorem cardinalInterFilter_aleph_one_iff :
    CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1) ‚Üî CountableInterFilter l :=
  ‚ü®fun _ ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®fun S h a ‚Ü¶
    CardinalInterFilter.cardinal_sInter_mem S ((countable_iff_lt_aleph_one S).1 h) a‚ü©,
   fun _ ‚Ü¶ CountableInterFilter.toCardinalInterFilter l‚ü©
```

nodes.body:
Thank you for doing this; many apologies for being so slow to review.

I was going to suggest that we do not need to have both `CardinalInterFilter` and `CountableInterFilter` and that instead of adding this new definition could we just replace `CountableInterFilter` with `CardinalInterFilter` and:
```
abbrev CountableInterFilter (l : Filter Œ±) := CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1)
```
as well as API for `CountableInterFilter` to connect with `Set.Countable`.

However it is not clear to me that every user of `CountableInterFilter` should need to import the full theory of ordinals, so this seems like a reasonable case for having two definitions (at least for now).

The code looks great, I have some nitpicks below and I'll take another pass quickly after you have replied.

Thanks again for doing this.

Please also add a comment to the `CountableInterFilter` file saying something like:
```
Note that there also exists a typeclass `CardinalInterFilter`, and thus an alternative spelling of
`CountableInterFilter` as `CardinalInterFilter l (aleph 1)`. The former (defined here) is the
preferred spelling; it has the advantage of not requiring the user to import the theory ordinals.
```
(or similar)

bors d+
